comment: We all remember that awkward teenage phase where we wanted to be different for the sake of being different. Hell, this is the internet, maybe you're still in yours. Jeffy will look back on this in about five years and cringe. The guy in the back is recalling his own awkward teenage phase.

I don’t know why people hide prep time in the ingredients list of the recipes they post online. I’m perfectly happy to cook something more elaborate but the it’s the lies that drive me bonkers. This is also one of the many reasons why you should read a recipe in full before you start cooking.
This is a completely accurate portrayal of how putting in contacts works, by the by, I wore them for years.

When you want to elongate a word you shouldn’t use hard consonants or silent letters to do so or this is what I hear in my head. I wouldn’t go so far as to call this an outright pet peeve as it doesn’t REALLY annoy me, but it is weird to parse words in your head this way because people don’t think about it when typing. The exceptions are consonants that can be stressed (like N, M, F, or S).
